results.abstract: List of upcoming benefit events in New York
results.snippet: Shakespeare Inspiration    TUESDAY -- Kevin Kline and Sigourney Weaver will perform excerpts from Shakespeare's works, and Marin Mazzie and Jason Danieley will sing songs from musicals based on Shakespeare's plays, in a benefit for the New 42d...
results.lead_paragraph: Shakespeare Inspiration TUESDAY -- Kevin Kline and Sigourney Weaver will perform excerpts from Shakespeare's works, and Marin Mazzie and Jason Danieley will sing songs from musicals based on Shakespeare's plays, in a benefit for the New 42d Street Inc. Proceeds will go to the organization's New Victory Theater and the New 42d Street Studio, a building under construction on 42d Street that will house rehearsal and office space for nonprofit performing arts organizations and a theater. Marian S. Heiskell, the chairwoman of the organization, will be honored. Bill Irwin, the actor and performance artist, will be the master of ceremonies. The black-tie evening will begin with the show at 7 in the New Victory, 209 West 42d Street. Dinner will follow at the Marriott Marquis. Tickets, $1,000, from (212) 564-4222.

results.abstract: Ben Ratliff reviews first American performance by Japanese Minimalist electronic composer Ryoji Ikeda at Experimental Intermedia; photo (M)

headline.main: Visions in the Darkness, Mostly From Electrons

results.snippet: The Japanese Minimalist electronic composer Ryoji Ikeda makes stainless-steel music. It's not of the physical world; nowhere in it can one recognize a traditional instrument. His pieces are constructed out of sine waves and tiny electronic connection...
results.lead_paragraph: The Japanese Minimalist electronic composer Ryoji Ikeda makes stainless-steel music. It's not of the physical world; nowhere in it can one recognize a traditional instrument. His pieces are constructed out of sine waves and tiny electronic connection noises, short beeping tones and radio static, and the occasional report of an astronaut or some news commentary. They have information-age connotations, but they spell beauty not overload. Mr. Ikeda arranges the elements of his pieces delicately, with a lot of empty space and nearly subliminal sounds; the care in their design not only precludes boredom (a clear hazard with the new, abstract electronic music) but also rearranges your senses. You can almost see the music pass before your eyes.

results.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-11    U.S. Seeks Blockade Of Yugoslavs' Oil  The United States wants NATO to plan ways of blocking deliveries of oil to Yugoslavia by sea, which have continued even as allied warplanes bomb refineries and oil storage installations...
results.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-11 U.S. Seeks Blockade Of Yugoslavs' Oil The United States wants NATO to plan ways of blocking deliveries of oil to Yugoslavia by sea, which have continued even as allied warplanes bomb refineries and oil storage installations on land, allied officials said. But the Kosovo campaign is a war fought by committee, the 19-nation alliance, and the American request ran up against objections. A1 In listing its bombing targets in Yugoslavia, NATO has generally described them as installations that feed the war machine of President Slobodan Milosevic. What the alliance does not usually say is that some of the refineries and factories have also been chosen as targets because they are run by close cronies of the Yugoslav President. A1

results.abstract: Holland Cotter reviews constructions by Chuck Nanney, at Debs & Company gallery (S)
results.snippet: Chuck Nanney  'Space Oddity (Lesson in Survival)'  Debs & Company  529 West 20th Street  Chelsea  Through May 1      Chuck Nanney is probably best known for his deadpan, bearded photographic self-portraits for which he dressed in girls' clothes. But...
results.lead_paragraph: Chuck Nanney 'Space Oddity (Lesson in Survival)' Debs & Company 529 West 20th Street Chelsea Through May 1 Chuck Nanney is probably best known for his deadpan, bearded photographic self-portraits for which he dressed in girls' clothes. But the work in his current show is as much about the interior as the exterior of the body.
